intro: Sandwithiodoxa, commonly known as the bluebell, is a flowering plant native to the woodlands of Europe. It belongs to the family Orchidaceae and is characterized by its bell-shaped, blue or purple flowers. The plant typically grows to a height of about 30–60 centimeters and thrives in moist, shaded environments. Its leaves are lance-shaped and arranged in a basal rosette, while its roots are fibrous and help anchor it in the soil. Sandwithiodoxa is valued for its ornamental beauty and plays an important role in supporting local pollinators.
